meanings.definition: To warn or advise someone firmly.
meanings.sent1: She was monishing her little brother to be careful while crossing the street.
meanings.sent2: The teacher monished the students to study hard for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent3: The cat was monishing the dog not to chase the birds.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were monishing the town of the impending rain.
meanings.sent5: His serious tone was monishing us to pay attention to his words.

meanings.definition: The act of giving a warning or advice.
meanings.sent1: His monishing of the team members helped them avoid making a mistake.
meanings.sent2: The monishing from the lifeguard reminded the swimmers to stay close to shore.
meanings.sent3: The monishing from the sign about wet floors made her chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The monishing of the alarm clock woke him up with a start.
meanings.sent5: The monishing of the traffic light kept the pedestrians safe from harm.
